epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including foot paths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1% by weight
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m続 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good across all states
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, reducing net CO2 emissions
carbonation.note: Not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_methods.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_methods.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_methods.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation_approach: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Some impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, radioactive waste disposal underground, and natural soil radon.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V4.0 and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017

contact_information.company_address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
